properties.name: recipe version
properties.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

properties.name: recipe process event configuration
properties.description: The Recipe Process Event Configuration is a name/value pair that describes the configuration of a Process Event, derived from Recipe that the Process Event's Production Run.  It is part of a set of configurations that contain information that the Production Run needs to communicate through its Process Events.

collections.description: The Recipe Process Event Configuration describes the relationship between the Recipe and any Process Events which may be produced from a Production Run that uses that recipe.  Different Process Events have different properties depending on their type or the version of the recipe employed.

properties.name: process user id
properties.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

properties.name: process event acknowledged by person id
process event acknowledged by name
properties.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

properties.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

properties.name: product batch date-time
properties.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

decorativeSymbols.name: PROCESS Domain CDM
decorativeSymbols.value:
# Digital Membership
## PROCESS Domain Logical Data Model

- author: timothy.galvin@atos.net
- version: 0.3.2
- date: 5-jan-2024

This is the PROCESS Domain LDM for the Digital Membership data architecture.  This provides a specification for the data objects and their interrelationships that govern the business aspects of medicines manufacturing process with the Digital Membership.

The starting point for the definitions in this CDM is the OPC UA 10000 Specification (v.1.05.03)

decorativeSymbols.name: TODO
decorativeSymbols.value: Determine if the "Process Event Recipe".configuration should be a set of values within the join entity, or broken out in to a separate entity.  Simplify for now (as of 0.3.2).
